intro: Blakwellia tetrandra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the leaves are narrow and linear. Blakwellia tetrandra is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
